adrFormatAddress: 474 W Broadway, New York, NY 10012, USA

originalText.text: This store is the best. The staff are kind, knowledgeable,  and extremely helpful. Response times are very fast. Juline has always helped me with my orders over the years. I highly recommend her, and her great customer service skills. Thank you Whitewall for always being the very best in all aspects. A well deserved 5 star rating!

text.text: This store is the best. The staff are kind, knowledgeable,  and extremely helpful. Response times are very fast. Juline has always helped me with my orders over the years. I highly recommend her, and her great customer service skills. Thank you Whitewall for always being the very best in all aspects. A well deserved 5 star rating!

originalText.text: So I got hold of six frames myself with very specific and strange dimensions. I wanted to put some of my own pictures in there, printed on decent photo paper and not posters, to guarantee quality. It was pretty difficult to find any company that lets you fully customize large photo prints and has different types of paper to chose from. If I did find one, their website software to upload and adjust pictures had glitches or flat out didn't work. Luckily Whitewall was my savior! The website is modern, easily navigable and cost of products is clear. I placed my order on 3 Jan. and my pics arrived today, 11 Jan., after UPS lost the package for a day. The pictures were neatly packed in a sturdy tube with a fragile-sticker on them and each print was separated with plastic film. When ordering, the website gave me an option to allow staff to adjust the darkness on pictures when printing, which I did. So I did not have any dark pictures at all; they look exactly like on my computer. I really have nothing to complain about at all (which is rare). Would definitely recommend for prints!

originalText.text: whitewall printers did an exceptional job reproducing canvas prints for my gallery show in nyc this weekend. exceeded my expectations covering many aspects including canvas caliber, framing woodwork & assembly, and most importantly image quality and coloring. impressive work, will definitely recommend to colleagues looking to to bolster their own art projects.

text.text: whitewall printers did an exceptional job reproducing canvas prints for my gallery show in nyc this weekend. exceeded my expectations covering many aspects including canvas caliber, framing woodwork & assembly, and most importantly image quality and coloring. impressive work, will definitely recommend to colleagues looking to to bolster their own art projects.

originalText.text:
I used Whitewall to produce prints of my photographs for customers for several years. When I discovered that my prints would be produced in Germany, I nearly dropped them right there, but since they offered FedEx overnight shipping for an extra $1 (at the time) I stuck with them. Their work was stunning, every order perfect, and my prints would arrive on my doorstep no more than 3 days after submitting my order. The schedule was so consistent that I was able to reduce the estimated production time for my prints.

Then, in early 2021, everything changed. Suddenly an order was late. Then another. Turns out they were no longer shipping via FedEx International Priority; now it was International Economy, which meant that 3 days would now be a week at the earliest. Clearly, this was a policy change that I believe should have been spelled out, particularly for the professional photographers who rely on their production house to produce prints on a consistent schedule.

When I contacted them, all I got was condescending blah blah blah. They blamed COVID (give me a break!), claimed there was no policy change at all, and that the schedule I had enjoyed for two straight years was some sort of fluke. But the change was right there, as plain as day: orders that once shipped Priority were now shipping Economy.

I'll never understand why companies choose gaslighting over honesty. All Whitewall had to do was admit they made a change and explain why they did so. It's the difference between a 5-star rave and a 1-star pan, as evidenced by this review.

When I discovered that my prints would be produced in Germany, I nearly dropped them right there, but since they offered FedEx overnight shipping for an extra $1 (at the time) I stuck with them. Their work was stunning, every order perfect, and my prints would arrive on my doorstep no more than 3 days after submitting my order. The schedule was so consistent that I was able to reduce the estimated production time for my prints.

Then, in early 2021, everything changed. Suddenly an order was late. Then another. Turns out they were no longer shipping via FedEx International Priority; now it was International Economy, which meant that 3 days would now be a week at the earliest. Clearly, this was a policy change that I believe should have been spelled out, particularly for the professional photographers who rely on their production house to produce prints on a consistent schedule.

When I contacted them, all I got was condescending blah blah blah. They blamed COVID (give me a break!), claimed there was no policy change at all, and that the schedule I had enjoyed for two straight years was some sort of fluke. But the change was right there, as plain as day: orders that once shipped Priority were now shipping Economy.

I'll never understand why companies choose gaslighting over honesty. All Whitewall had to do was admit they made a change and explain why they did so. It's the difference between a 5-star rave and a 1-star pan, as evidenced by this review.

originalText.text:
Avoid the hassle, print and frame domestic and support your local businesses, you'll have a better experience 100% of the time.

I'll caveat this review by saying: Im still waiting to get my final product and im sure its going to turn out ok. Its the service and customer journey that made this a nightmare. I will also say they "made a exception" and issued me a refund so I could correct the image, but mind you this is after spending 3 + day fighting them at 3am ET which is when their offices in Germany are open. Chances are you wont be seeing your money back without putting up a good fight.

UX experience is pathetic. The product builder is riddled with bad code. The pricing changes sporadically, which means the option configurator has input mistakes throughout. When the user uploads an image to the configurator and sets their preferences, the preview of the final product does not reflect 1) the quality of the image uploaded 2) the size of the product selected relative to the background digital space and 3) the zoom-in function simply doesn't work. This makes it impossible to see what you are getting, which is frustrating considering the heavy price tag and shipping costs involved with getting anything from whitewall (they only operate in Germany so you will have to wait and pay a heavy shipping price). I got two framed 16x24 pieces for over 500 USD, ouch.

As for the pricing, let's just say its predatory. Pricing is different depending on how you select your product (and how you arrive to the site) and even if the product is exactly the same, the price will be different depending on how to build it. From the configurator, often times you get higher prices and less options. Directly from the website top bar menu links you get lower pricing and more options in the configurator. It simply makes no sense. This is NOT intuitive human centered design. It's confusing on purpose and it feels predatory. Thy have a german/EU site and US equivalent, you guessed it. Pricing changes here too (when accounting for FX changes)

The disclaimers, refund policy and cancelation policy is NOT EASILY VISIBLE. There is no confirmation screen to agree, verify and check that you are ordering the correct products before hitting submit to pay.

My entire issue had to do with submitting an order with an image that was not the final version (yes, i know this was my mistake). However, I noticed later that day, (3hours later) and upon trying to edit the order, it was impossible since they have a 2 hour (YES 2 hour) cancelation policy.

This is simply outrageous considering their production facility is in Germany. I placed the order in the afternoon/evening in the east coast, which means in Germany everyone is checking out for the day. Unless they had staff starting my order past working hours or have a fully automated printing press (which they don't BTW) , this should not been a hard issue to fix. This policy is absurd.

There is no way to confirm your product selection, so if you or they make any mistakes YOU will literally PAY FOR THEM.

The sales reps are inexperienced (in NYC office), have no deep understanding on the product catalogue or even the pricing catalogue and seem to have very basic knowledge of the products they are selling, their configurations, optionality, and overall any understanding of the core concepts behind fine art print. This is problematic. They also are poor communicators, bad negotiators, and lack people skills. They lack knowledge of how their platform works and how their company operates.

Shipping internationally and the price tag associated with an 11 day shipping process is a huge turn off from any customer in the USA. The only reason I bought from them is because they have the nice color acrylic glass frames, which I asked to buy on their own and the company REFUSED (again why did they refuse, predatory tactics so I had to print with them).

Any domestic printing startup will do a better, faster, cheaper job, no need to go to Germany. I wont event talk about customer service because its non-existent.
